definition: individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: In the United States, the emphasis on individual autonomy usually results in stigmatization of the accused offender.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，强调个人主义，通常会导致罪犯被告上法庭。

sentences.english: One reason is that we are very individualistic.
sentences.chinese: 其中之一是非常个人主义。

sentences.english: At last the author summarizes the new women individualism in Little Women.
sentences.chinese: 最后，笔者总结了在“小妇人”新女性个人主义。

sentences.english: He expressed a non-mainstream thinking of the tendencies of individualism in his works.
sentences.chinese: 在其作品中袒露出非主流思想的个人主义倾向。

sentences.english: Clearly, his ideas about the individualistic nature of religion were important to him.
sentences.chinese: 显然，对于宗教其个人主义性质的想法对他相当重要。

sentences.english: He was also regarded as a chief leader of individualism.
sentences.chinese: 爱默生同样也被视为个人主义的主要倡导人。

sentences.english: Nationals of the United States not to the absolute individualism and pragmatism.
sentences.chinese: 不要将美国国民性中的实用主义和个人主义绝对化。

sentences.english: Their individualism finds expression in pleasure-seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他们的个人主义表现为享乐思想。

sentences.english: Some coming from East Asian societies have said, this emphasis in the West on individualism.
sentences.chinese: 有些东亚社会的人说，西方这种强调个人主义的思想。
本位主义是放大了的个人主义。

sentences.english: Individualism is misunderstood and one - side explained in the traditional academic field of China.
sentences.chinese: 个人主义在中国传统学界存在着误解和片面性解释。

sentences.english: It's like a lot of individualism at the same time as well.
sentences.chinese: 同时也体现了个人主义。

sentences.english: They are a fiercely individual bunch and should stick with I.
sentences.chinese: 他们是一群极端个人主义的人，应当坚持使用“我”。
